scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You responded by focusing on motivating the team by recalling past successes. Monica's frustration is still palpable, and Bob's agreement seems to add to the tension. [Monica] then leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, 'It's not just about trying hard; we need more resources.' [Bob] muttered, 'Yeah, we're drowning here.' You emphasized control and optimization of current resources, showing balanced emotional intelligence. [Monica] sighed deeply and said, 'Motivation alone isn't going to get us through this. We need concrete action.' [Bob] added, 'We need a plan that actually addresses our current capacity.'
scenes.description: [Monica] and [Bob] look at you expectantly, waiting for your next move.

options.text: I hear you both. Let's take a step back and reassess our resources and tasks. We can find a way to manage this better.
options.analysis: You acknowledged their concerns and suggested a pragmatic approach, demonstrating good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I understand your point. Let's focus on what we can control and optimize our current resources.
options.analysis: You recognized the concerns but emphasized control and optimization, showing balanced emotional intelligence.

options.text: We've tackled impossible tasks before. Let's show that we can handle this by giving it our best shot.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team by recalling past challenges, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
